org.jetel.data.parser

Class SimpleDataParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.data.parser.AbstractParser
      • org.jetel.data.parser.AbstractTextParser
        • org.jetel.data.parser.SimpleDataParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Parser, TextParser

    public class SimpleDataParser
extends AbstractTextParser
    This parser is as simple as posible - limited validation, error handling, functionality - but very fast. List of limitation:
    • trim, skipLeadingBlanks and skipTraillingBlanks is omitted
    • only delimited output metadata are accepted
    • skip method is not supported
    • all output metadata fields has to have first character occurence ony ones
    • movePosition() method for incremental reading is not supported

      • postExecute

        public void postExecute()
                 throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: Parser
        Life-cycle hook. Follows the semantics of Node.postExecute() Called by the owner of the parser after each graph phase execution. NOTE! postExecute should do exactly the same thing as deprecated method reset(). The only advantage over reset() is that it matches with the name of Node's life-cycle method postExecute().
        Specified by:
        postExecute in interface Parser
        Overrides:
        postExecute in class AbstractTextParser
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - Catch-all exception

      • free

        public void free()
        Description copied from interface: Parser
        Life-cycle hook. Follows the semantics of Node.free() Called by the owner of the parser to release resources when the parser is not needed anymore NOTE! free() should do exactly the same thing as deprecated method close(). The only advantage over close() is that it matches with the name of Node's life-cycle method free().
        Specified by:
        free in interface Parser
        Overrides:
        free in class AbstractTextParser
